basics.name: Kayla-Marie Torres
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024. I have a B.A. In Sociology.

organizations.name: Native Hawaiians in Science and Engineering Mentorship Program (NHSEMP)
organizations.description: The Native Hawaiian Science & Engineering Mentorship Program's main component is the undergraduate STEM Scholars Program, held during the academic year. Students who are willing to put in the extra time, effort, and energy into meeting their academic goals can participate in the in the program in various ways. A hub for academic support, financial support, social & community building, and service.

work.position: Data Driven Agriculture Research and Extenstion Experiences for Undergraduates (REEU)
highlights: Innovative research team of ten Pacific Islanders across a 8-week program covering data collection in a greenhouse to data analyzing with R Studio. We worked as a cohort to build 5 posters to present at UH’s 2023 undergraduate summer research symposium. Included weekly field trips to non-profit organizations, and research extensions where we got a chance to network with potential employers and members of the community.

volunteer.organization: Native Hawaiians in Science and Engineering Mentorship Program (NHSEMP)
highlights: STEM Scholar- Creating leaders in the Native Hawaiian and Pacific Island communities through academic excellence in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics

FP404- Mentoring two students from Lana’i High School with their STEM senior project. During weekly meetings I guide them on their Ma’i Project, where they are increasing access to feminine hygiene products on campus.

awards.title: Pauahi Foundation
awards.summary: Helping nurture the dreams of Native Hawaiian learners.

awards.title: Starr Foundation Science and Technology Scholarship Fund
